    <!-- REGION CONTENT -->
    <div id="maincontent" class="row">
      <ol class="breadcrumb"><li><a class="glyphicon glyphicon-home" aria-hidden="true" href="/"><span class="hide">Home</span></a></li>
<li><a href="/faculties-and-units">Faculties and units</a></li>

</ol>
              <aside class="col-sm-3 sidebar-first" role="complementary">
            <div class="region region-sidebar-first well">
    <section id="block-menu-block-sidebar-nav" class="block block-menu-block clearfix">

      
  <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-sidebar_nav menu-name-menu-og-7716 parent-mlid-18656 menu-level-1">
  <ul class="menu nav navbar-nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-21301"><a href="/faculty-of-classics"><span>Faculty of Classics</span></a></li>

      <section class="col-sm-9">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">The Ertegun Graduate Scholarship Programme in the Humanities</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-basic-page node-116131"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-9 col-lg-9"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-86861" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p>As Ertegun Scholars, the world's top graduate students in the humanities are brought together with one another and with Oxford's exceptional community of scholars in a unique setting that fosters dialogue across academic disciplines, across cultures and across generations. Building on this foundation at Oxford, Ertegun Scholars leave the University prepared to be leaders - not only leaders in their chosen fields, but also leaders of global thought and opinion and leaders of positive action for the betterment of humanity.</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-86866" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>Research Showcase</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h3>Podcast: Exploring Humanities - The Ertegun Scholarship Programme</h3>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
            <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/exploring-humanities-ertegun-scholarship-programme.jpg?itok=1MdasaUh" alt="Exploring Humanities - Ertegun Scholarship Programme" /></div>
<p>Podcasts from the Ertegun House which provides the Ertegun Scholarship Programme with a high-profile presence at Oxford, serving as a resource for Ertegun Scholars and for visitors from around the world who will come to Oxford to participate in a programme of events arranged by the Scholar in Residence.</p>
<p><a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/units/ertegun-graduate-scholarships-programme" target="_blank">More podcasts relating to the Ertegun Graduate Scholarships programme</a></p>
<p> </p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-86856" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image image-thumbnail align-right">
        <a href="http://www.ertegun.ox.ac.uk/home">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_thumbnail/public/humanities/images/page/ertegun_logo.jpg?itok=7U7HIPEK" alt="Ertegun Graduate Scholarship Programme in the Humanities" /></a></div>
<p class="rtecenter">For more information, visit the Ertegun Scholarship website</p>
<hr /><p> </p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Graduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/graduate/courses/courses-by-department?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p> </p>
<hr /></div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
    </div>
  
  </div>
</div>
</section>
  </div>
      </section>

  <!-- main container -->
  <div id="main-container" class="container">

    <!-- REGION CONTENT -->
    <div id="maincontent" class="row">
      <ol class="breadcrumb"><li><a class="glyphicon glyphicon-home" aria-hidden="true" href="/"><span class="hide">Home</span></a></li>
<li class="active">Faculty of Music Concert: Ustad Rahat Fateh Ali Khan</li>
</ol>
            
      <section class="col-sm-12">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Faculty of Music Concert: Ustad Rahat Fateh Ali Khan</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-event node-137991"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel top col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-1"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-1 paragraphs-items-field-region-1-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-1 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="panelizer-view-mode paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-full paragraphs-item-metadata-display paragraphs-item-124726 margin-bottom" id="panelizer-item-124726" >
        <div class="panel-flexible panels-flexible-new clearfix" >
<div class="panel-flexible-inside panels-flexible-new-inside">
<div class="panels-flexible-region panels-flexible-region-new-center panels-flexible-region-first panels-flexible-region-last">
  <div class="inside panels-flexible-region-inside panels-flexible-region-new-center-inside panels-flexible-region-inside-first panels-flexible-region-inside-last">
<div class="panel-pane pane-metadata"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="panel panel-default">
    <div class="meta-container">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-event-date field-type-date field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><span class="date-display-single" property="dc:date" datatype="xsd:dateTime" content="2017-05-25T20:00:00+00:00">25 May 20:00</span></div>
            </div>
</div>

<div class="field field-name-field-location field-type-text field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even">Sheldonian Theatre</div>
            </div>
</div>

<div class="field field-name-field-event-presenter field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image image-thumbnail align-left">
            <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_thumbnail/public/humanities/images/media/music_logo_single.jpg?itok=WTpbhbFY" alt="Faculty of Music Logo" /></div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
    </div>
</div>  </div>

  
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
    </div>
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-9 col-lg-9"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-124731" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image medium align-center">
            <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_medium/public/humanities/images/media/ali_khan.jpg?itok=xIuGsPzU" alt="Ustad Rahat Fateh Ali Khan" /></div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-124736" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p>Rahat Fateh Ali Khan is a popular Pakistani singer, primarily of Qawwali, the devotional music of the Muslim Sufis. He began his career at the age of three, performing and studying under the tutelage of the “King of Qawwali”, Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan. Since then he has taken on the responsibility of carrying forward his 600 year old family legacy by spreading qawwali to audiences across the globe. He has also gained a vast following through his work in Bollywood and has regularly sold out arena tours in the UK, the US, the Middle East and India.</p>
<div id="post-15832">
<div>
<p>Khan will perform alongside The Fusion Project, an ensemble of students from Oxford University brought together by their shared mission to revive and make accessible the beauty of Indian Classical Arts.</p>
<p>The programme will comprise of a series of original fusion compositions and qawwalis arranged and produced by Rushil Ranjan, the lead singer and guitarist of the Fusion Project. Along with Khan’s impressive vocals they will feature western vocals, tabla drums and a bansuri.</p>
<p>Tickets available from <a href="http://tig.mus/rahat" target="_blank">Tig.mus/rahat</a></p>
<p><a href="https://www.music.ox.ac.uk/event/concert-ustad-rahat-fateh-ali-khan/" target="_blank"><strong>For further information, please see the Faculty of Music Website</strong></a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="panelizer-view-mode paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-full paragraphs-item-event-listing paragraphs-item-124741 margin-bottom" id="panelizer-item-124741" >
        <H2 >
              More Events...          </H2>

  <div id="main-container" class="container">

    <!-- REGION CONTENT -->
    <div id="maincontent" class="row">
      <ol class="breadcrumb"><li><a class="glyphicon glyphicon-home" aria-hidden="true" href="/"><span class="hide">Home</span></a></li>
<li class="active">Graduate applicants: save the date! </li>

      <section class="col-sm-12">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Graduate applicants: save the date! </h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-event node-117216"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
      <div class="row">

  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-1 paragraphs-items-field-region-1-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-1 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="panelizer-view-mode paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-full paragraphs-item-metadata-display paragraphs-item-88581 margin-bottom" id="panelizer-item-88581" >

  <div class="inside panels-flexible-region-inside panels-flexible-region-new-center-inside panels-flexible-region-inside-first panels-flexible-region-inside-last">
<div class="panel-pane pane-metadata"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="panel panel-default">
    <div class="meta-container">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-event-date field-type-date field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><span class="date-display-single" property="dc:date" datatype="xsd:dateTime" content="2017-03-15T14:00:00+00:00">15 March 14:00</span></div>
            </div>

<div class="field field-name-field-location field-type-text field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even">Faculty of English Language and Literature, St Cross Building, Oxford, OX1 3UL</div>

<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-4 paragraphs-items-field-region-4-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-4 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-88586" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Save the date!</h4>
<p>Our welcome day for successful applicants to Oxford will be held on Wednesday 15 March 2017. All applicants who have been offered a place on Master's and Doctoral programmes in English beginning in October 2017 will be invited to meet each other, their future tutors, and on-course students.</p>
<p><a href="https://english.web.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/english/documents/media/graduate_welcome_to_oxford.pdf"><strong>Welcome to Oxford - Programme</strong></a></p>

      <ol class="breadcrumb"><li><a class="glyphicon glyphicon-home" aria-hidden="true" href="/"><span class="hide">Home</span></a></li>
<li class="active">LGBT History Month: Oxford History Faculty LGBT Workshop</li>
</ol>
            
      <section class="col-sm-12">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">LGBT History Month: Oxford History Faculty LGBT Workshop</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-event node-109756"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel top col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-1"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-1 paragraphs-items-field-region-1-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-1 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="panelizer-view-mode paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-full paragraphs-item-metadata-display paragraphs-item-82516 margin-bottom" id="panelizer-item-82516" >
        <div class="panel-flexible panels-flexible-new clearfix" >
<div class="panel-flexible-inside panels-flexible-new-inside">
<div class="panels-flexible-region panels-flexible-region-new-center panels-flexible-region-first panels-flexible-region-last">
  <div class="inside panels-flexible-region-inside panels-flexible-region-new-center-inside panels-flexible-region-inside-first panels-flexible-region-inside-last">
<div class="panel-pane pane-metadata"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="panel panel-default">
    <div class="meta-container">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-event-date field-type-date field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><span class="date-display-single" property="dc:date" datatype="xsd:dateTime" content="2017-02-10T14:00:00+00:00">10 February 14:00</span></div>
            </div>
</div>

<div class="field field-name-field-location field-type-text field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even">Faculty of History, George Street, Oxford, OX1 2RL</div>
            </div>
</div>

<div class="field field-name-field-event-presenter field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p class="rtecenter"> </p>
<h4>Centre for Gender, Identity, and Subjectivity, Faculty of History</h4>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
    </div>
</div>  </div>

  
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-82546" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image large align-center">
            <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_large/public/history/images/media/rainbow_flag.jpg?itok=70COYhxN" alt="LGBT Workshop timetable poster" /></div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
    </div>

  <!-- REGION FOOTER TOP -->
  <div id="wrapper-footer" class="wrapper">
        <div id="footer" class="container">
      <div class="row">
          <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-site-footer node-7746"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-fourcol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-1"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-1 paragraphs-items-field-region-1-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-1 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-47436" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>INFORMATION ABOUT</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/about/organisation?wssl=1" target="_blank">Oxford University</a></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/research?wssl=1" target="_blank">Oxford's Research</a></p>
<p><a href="http://www.ox.ac.uk/node/1783/" target="_blank">Fees and funding</a></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/research/libraries?wssl=1" target="_blank">Libraries</a></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/visitors/visiting-oxford/visiting-museums-libraries-places?wssl=1" target="_blank">Museums and Collections</a></p>
<p><a href="http://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/visiting-and-outreach/open-days" target="_blank">Open days</a></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/about/organisation/history/oxford-glossary?wssl=1" target="_blank">Oxford Glossary</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel second col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">

    <div id="maincontent" class="row">
      <ol class="breadcrumb"><li><a class="glyphicon glyphicon-home" aria-hidden="true" href="/"><span class="hide">Home</span></a></li>
<li class="active">Philosophy Undergraduate Open Day</li>
</ol>
            
      <section class="col-sm-12">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Philosophy Undergraduate Open Day</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-event node-120141"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-6 col-lg-6"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-accordion-content margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-97946" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-accordion-section field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="view view-field-collection-accordion-view view-id-field_collection_accordion_view view-display-id-default view-dom-id-550b3380b69648e391edc6be0361ecdf">
        
  
  
      <div 
   >
      <div id="views-bootstrap-accordion-2" class="views-bootstrap-accordion-plugin-style panel-group">
        <div class="panel panel-default">
      <div class="panel-heading">
        <h4 class="panel-title">
          <a class="accordion-toggle collapsed"
             data-toggle="collapse"
             data-parent="#collapse2-0"
             href="#collapse2-0"
             name="collapse2-0"
             target="_self">
            What?          </a>
        </h4>
      </div>

      <div id="collapse2-0" class="panel-collapse collapse">
        <div class="panel-body">
            
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-section-content">        <div class="field-content"></div>  </div>        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div></div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-101901" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p>This event is aimed at potential applicants interested in studying on one of the eight different degrees in Oxford which have philosophy as a major component. There will be talks on philosophical topics (one main lecture and some shorter, more ‘degree specific’ ones), a general admissions-related talk and a chance to talk to students already at Oxford.  You can find out more about the courses on the <a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/courses-listing?wssl=1">Undergraduate Admissions pages</a> of the university website.</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-accordion-content margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-101916" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-accordion-section field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="view view-field-collection-accordion-view view-id-field_collection_accordion_view view-display-id-default view-dom-id-63b994d8a426640874d1b609580f3373">
        
  
  
      <div 
   >
      <div id="views-bootstrap-accordion-3" class="views-bootstrap-accordion-plugin-style panel-group">
        <div class="panel panel-default">
      <div class="panel-heading">
        <h4 class="panel-title">
          <a class="accordion-toggle collapsed"
             data-toggle="collapse"
             data-parent="#collapse3-0"
             href="#collapse3-0"
             name="collapse3-0"
             target="_self">
            When?          </a>
        </h4>
      </div>

      <div id="collapse3-0" class="panel-collapse collapse">
        <div class="panel-body">
            
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-section-content">        <div class="field-content"></div>  </div>        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div></div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-101921" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p><span style="color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;">The event will be on </span><strong style="color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;">Saturday 6<span style="position: relative; font-size: 12px; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">th</span> May 2017</strong><span style="color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;">, from mid-morning to mid-afternoon.  Registration will be from 10.30am, and the formal programme will be over by 2.45pm, though we hope that some staff and students may be around for a little longer to field any remaining questions informally. </span>Please fill out the <a href="https://weblearn.ox.ac.uk/direct/eval-evaluation/15826" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);" target="_blank">registration form</a> if you wish to attend.</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-accordion-content margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-101926" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-accordion-section field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="view view-field-collection-accordion-view view-id-field_collection_accordion_view view-display-id-default view-dom-id-f1bc058a363fd9f80a043a7db66540d3">
        
  
  
      <div 
   >
      <div id="views-bootstrap-accordion-4" class="views-bootstrap-accordion-plugin-style panel-group">
        <div class="panel panel-default">
      <div class="panel-heading">
        <h4 class="panel-title">
          <a class="accordion-toggle collapsed"
             data-toggle="collapse"
             data-parent="#collapse4-0"
             href="#collapse4-0"
             name="collapse4-0"
             target="_self">
            Where?          </a>
        </h4>
      </div>

      <div id="collapse4-0" class="panel-collapse collapse">
        <div class="panel-body">
            
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-section-content">        <div class="field-content"></div>  </div>        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div></div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-101931" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p><span style="color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;">The event will be held in the Andrew Wiles Building, an excellent new space next door to the Philosophy Faculty, and which is home to the </span><a href="http://www.maths.ox.ac.uk/about-us/our-building" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: underline; word-wrap: normal; font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.8571434020996px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">Mathematical Institute</a><span style="color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;">.</span></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-accordion-content margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-101936" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-accordion-section field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="view view-field-collection-accordion-view view-id-field_collection_accordion_view view-display-id-default view-dom-id-1128e7a1f809157b62ab3db82f38fe55">
        
  
  
      <div 
   >
      <div id="views-bootstrap-accordion-5" class="views-bootstrap-accordion-plugin-style panel-group">
        <div class="panel panel-default">
      <div class="panel-heading">
        <h4 class="panel-title">
          <a class="accordion-toggle collapsed"
             data-toggle="collapse"
             data-parent="#collapse5-0"
             href="#collapse5-0"
             name="collapse5-0"
             target="_self">
            Who can come?          </a>
        </h4>
      </div>

      <div id="collapse5-0" class="panel-collapse collapse">
        <div class="panel-body">
            
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-section-content">        <div class="field-content"></div>  </div>        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div></div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-101941" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p style="font-size: 16px; color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;">The event is principally aimed at those in school year 12, who are thinking of applying to university next academic year. It doesn’t matter whether you are taking A levels; you could be taking the IB, pre-U qualifications, or other courses which would be suitable for university entrance.  You certainly do not need to be studying philosophy at present, or philosophical subjects studied under other labels – these are not an entrance requirement for any of our degrees.</p>
<p style="font-size: 16px; color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;">We have agreed with our friends in the Maths Institute security staffing cover for a limit of 150 attendees, so sadly in order to make this open to as many potential students as possible we will have to restrict entry just to them. Please fill out the <a href="https://weblearn.ox.ac.uk/direct/eval-evaluation/15826" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);" target="_blank">registration form</a> if you wish to attend. This means that we cannot accommodate parents or teachers. There are, of course, <a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/visitors/visiting-oxford/visiting-museums-libraries-places?wssl=1" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: underline; word-wrap: normal;">many attractions in Oxford</a> for family members who might be in the city for the day!</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-6 col-lg-6"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-97936" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">

<p><a href="https://weblearn.ox.ac.uk/direct/eval-evaluation/15826" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);" target="_blank">Open Day Registration Form</a></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/visiting-and-outreach/independent-visits?wssl=1">University Open Days</a></p>
<p><a href="http://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate_courses/open_days_events_and_visiting/open_events_and_visiting/university_open_days/travel_advice/index.html">Travel and parking advice</a></p>
<p><a href="https://philosophy.web.ox.ac.uk/find-us">Finding the Philosophy Faculty</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
    </div>
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel bottom col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-4"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-4 paragraphs-items-field-region-4-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-4 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-accordion-content margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-101946" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-accordion-section field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="view view-field-collection-accordion-view view-id-field_collection_accordion_view view-display-id-default view-dom-id-bacdd496588548ba864b6e8ddcbdc636">
        
  
  
      <div 
   >
      <div id="views-bootstrap-accordion-1" class="views-bootstrap-accordion-plugin-style panel-group">
        <div class="panel panel-default">
      <div class="panel-heading">
        <h4 class="panel-title">
          <a class="accordion-toggle collapsed"
             data-toggle="collapse"
             data-parent="#collapse1-0"
             href="#collapse1-0"
             name="collapse1-0"
             target="_self">
            Is it for me?          </a>
        </h4>
      </div>

      <div id="collapse1-0" class="panel-collapse collapse">
        <div class="panel-body">
            
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-section-content">        <div class="field-content"><p>If you are interested in one of these degree programmes, and are on target to achieve results in your current qualifications at the level indicated, then yes, absolutely.  We’ll be pleased to see you, and hope you’ll find the day interesting.  A quick summary can’t cover all of the nuances of the full prospectus, but this table gives an idea:</p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr><td valign="bottom" width="20%">
<p align="center"><strong>Degree</strong></p>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="20%">
<p align="center"><strong>Essential</strong></p>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="20%">
<p align="center"><strong>Recommended</strong></p>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="20%">
<p align="center"><strong>Helpful (not required)</strong></p>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="20%">
<p align="center"><strong>Standard Offer Grades</strong></p>
</td>
</tr><tr valign="top"><td width="20%">
<p>Literae Humaniores</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>Course I (only): Latin and/or Greek</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p> </p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p> </p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>AAA, IB 39 (666 at higher level)</p>
</td>
</tr><tr valign="top"><td width="20%">
<p>Philosophy &amp; Modern Languages</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>A modern language for chosen course</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p> </p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p> </p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>AAA, IB 39 (666 at higher level)</p>
</td>
</tr><tr valign="top"><td width="20%">
<p>Philosophy &amp; Theology</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p> </p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p> </p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>Essay-based subject</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>AAA, IB 39 (666 at higher level)</p>
</td>
</tr><tr valign="top"><td width="20%">
<p>Philosophy, Politics &amp; Economics</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p> </p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p> </p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>Mathematics, History</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>AAA, IB 39 (666 at higher level)</p>
</td>
</tr><tr valign="top"><td width="20%">
<p>Computer Science &amp; Philosophy</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>Mathematics</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>Further Mathematics or a science</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>An essay-based subject</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>A*AA, IB 39 (766 at higher level)</p>
</td>
</tr><tr valign="top"><td width="20%">
<p>Mathematics &amp; Philosophy</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>Mathematics</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>Further Mathematics</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p> </p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>A*A*A, IB 39 (766 at higher level)</p>
</td>
</tr><tr valign="top"><td width="20%">
<p>Physics &amp; Philosophy</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>Physics, Mathematics</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>Mechanics module in Maths</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>Further Mathematics, Arts subject</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>A*AA, IB 39 (766 at higher level)</p>
</td>
</tr><tr valign="top"><td width="20%">
<p>Psychology, Philosophy &amp; Linguistics</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p> </p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>Mathematics, science subjects</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>English language (for Linguistics)</p>
</td>
<td width="20%">
<p>A*AA, IB 39 (766 at higher level)</p>
</td>
</tr></tbody></table><p> </p>
<p>There’s a version of <u>Literae Humaniores</u>, Course 2, which does not require classical languages to A level (or an equivalent level in other qualifications); there are some modern languages which can be studied as a ‘beginner’ in <u>Philosophy and Modern Languages</u>.  For either, you’ll still need to have an aptitude for languages!  In <u>Psychology, Philosophy &amp; Linguistics</u> (PPL) you apply for just two of the three subjects, and each pair has a separate course code, which is very different from <u>Philosophy, Politics &amp; Economics</u> (PPE) where you apply for all three (though you can study just two from second year onwards).  For some degrees there will be a requirement to get an A* or equivalent in a specific subject; <u>Physics and Philosophy</u> will want an A* in Physics, Mathematics or Further Mathematics (or 7 at higher level on the IB in Maths or Physics).  Standard offer grades are listed for A levels and the International Baccalaureate, but can be found on-line for many other qualifications.</p>
</div>  </div>        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
      <div class="panel panel-default">
      <div class="panel-heading">
        <h4 class="panel-title">
          <a class="accordion-toggle collapsed"
             data-toggle="collapse"
             data-parent="#collapse1-1"
             href="#collapse1-1"
             name="collapse1-1"
             target="_self">
            Other information?          </a>
        </h4>
      </div>

      <div id="collapse1-1" class="panel-collapse collapse">
        <div class="panel-body">
            
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-section-content">        <div class="field-content"><p style="font-size: 16px; color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;">Sadly we cannot provide overnight accommodation for the event, which we appreciate will make it difficult for those from further away to come. We are investigating recording some of the talks so that they can be viewed more widely at a later date.</p>
<p style="font-size: 16px; color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;">Lunch will not be provided, and the café in the building is shut at the weekend, but there will be an area indoors to eat a packed lunch if you bring your own food, and we hope there will be current students around to talk to.  There are a few local eateries, but the time allocated for lunch may make it difficult to get very far from the building and return in time for the afternoon sessions.</p>
<p style="font-size: 16px; color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;"><strong>Data protection</strong></p>
<p style="font-size: 16px; color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;">We will need to take and store some personal details to handle your booking.  Because we plan to have degree-specific sessions in the afternoon it would be useful to know, to give an idea of numbers for room allocation, which degree you’re most interested in.  So we need your permission to use some specific information for the event. Please fill out the <a href="https://weblearn.ox.ac.uk/direct/eval-evaluation/15826" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);" target="_blank">registration form</a> if you wish to attend.</p>
<p style="font-size: 16px; color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;">We also ask you for a few further details, which do not directly affect the running of this event but are part of a cooperative endeavour to help develop a wider picture of access to Higher Education.  You may well be asked for the same information from a number of universities for the same purpose.  See <a href="http://heat.ac.uk/" style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: underline;">http://heat.ac.uk/</a></p>
<p style="font-size: 16px; color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: 'PT Sans', sans-serif; line-height: 22.8571434020996px;">It makes no difference in applying for the Open Day whether you give this further data and your permission, and you won’t benefit personally by letting the data be used.  However, future generations across the whole of UK education may benefit from our ability to track the usefulness of various types of training and events from school right the way through to getting established in a career.  So we’d be very grateful for your help.</p>
</div>  </div>        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div></div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
</section>
  </div>
      </section>

      <section class="col-sm-9">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Faculty of History</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-basic-page node-68021"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-9 col-lg-9"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-53121" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
            <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/72.dpi_.jpg?itok=g42DKxBw" alt="History Faculty Building" /></div>
<p>Medieval and modern history has been studied at Oxford for longer than at almost any other university: a Regius Professor of Modern History was first appointed in 1724, and undergraduate examinations began in 1850.</p>
<p>The History Faculty has more than 90 permanent academic staff. Of these, 15 are statutory Professors, or Readers. The majority of permanent academic staff, are joint appointees whose teaching responsibilities encompass both the Faculty and the individual college of appointment.</p>
<p> The Faculty also encompasses at any one time a number of historians employed by colleges – College Lecturers and short-term Junior Research Fellows – as well as those on fixed-term employment with the Faculty: Departmental Lecturers providing teaching for postholders on research leave, and research assistants on funded research projects. Its wider membership includes colleagues in a number of other faculties and departments across the University who work as historians or in closely cognate disciplines.</p>
<p>The University of Oxford is one of the world's most encompassing centres for the study of history. The faculty has nearly twelve hundred undergraduates, and almost five hundred graduate students attracted from around the world.</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78871" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>Teaching and Research Showcase</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Podcast: The English People at War in the Age of Henry VIII</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/series/english-people-war-age-henry-viii">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/english-people-war-age-henry-viii_0.jpg?itok=NqDRyyv-" alt="podcast: English People at war in the time of Henry VIII" /></a></div>
<p>In this history lecture series Professor Stephen Gunn look at the effects of war on the people of England in the 1500s. This lecture series was recorded in Hilary Term 2015 and is part of the annual James Ford Lectures in British History series at the Examination Schools in Oxford University.</p>
<p><a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/units/faculty-history" target="_blank">More podcasts relating to the Faculty of History</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78876" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Book: Martin Luther: Renegade and Prophet (Lyndal Roper, 2016)</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="https://www.history.ox.ac.uk/article/lyndal-roper-martin-luther-renegade-and-prophet-bodley-head">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/luther.jpg?itok=eM8JWYru" alt="Martin Luther: Renegade and Prophet" /></a></div>
<p>When Martin Luther nailed a sheet of paper to the church door of a small university town on 31 October 1517, he set off a process that changed the Western world for ever.</p>
<p>Luther’s ideas spread like wildfire. His attack on the Church soon convulsed Germany, divided Europe and polarised people’s beliefs. They triggered decades of religious persecution, social unrest and war. And in the long run, his ideas paradoxically helped break the grip of religion in every sphere of life.</p>
<p>But the man who started the Reformation was deeply flawed. He was a religious fundamentalist, a Jew-hater and a political reactionary. He was a fervent believer who was tormented by doubt, a brilliant writer who shaped the German language and a vicious and foul-mouthed polemicist. He was a married ex-monk who liberated human sexuality from the stigma of sin, but also a man who insisted that women should know their place. For him the Devil was not just a figure of speech but a very real and physical presence. </p>
<p>In this first historical biography for many decades, distinguished historian Lyndal Roper gives us a flesh-and-blood figure, warts and all. She reveals the often contradictory psychological forces that drove Luther forward – insecurity and self-righteousness, anger and humility – and the dynamics they unleashed which turned a small act of protest into a battle against the power of the Church.</p>
<p><a href="https://history.web.ox.ac.uk/recent-publications" target="_blank">More publications from the Faculty of History</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78881" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Project Centre: The Global History Centre</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="http://www.history.ox.ac.uk/oxford-centre-global-history">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/cd_research_oxford_centre_for_global_history.jpg?itok=OYh_OqQy" alt="Oxford Centre for Global History" /></a></div>
<p>The Oxford Centre for Global History was established by the History Faculty in June 2011 to reflect its strong commitment to the field. Global History in Oxford is defined broadly as the global movement of people, goods, and ideas and the consequences that flow from them. Chronologically, it extends across all historical periods from ancient to late modern.</p>
<p>The Centre is particularly keen to encourage cooperation between historians of different periods, as well as places, in the study of themes of global significance. It will support research projects, and host workshops, seminars, and conferences. A key part of the Centre’s role is to facilitate the research of all those in Oxford who are keen to develop a global history dimension in their work. </p>
<p><strong><a href="http://global.history.ox.ac.uk/" target="_blank">http://global.history.ox.ac.uk</a></strong></p>
<p><a href="http://www.history.ox.ac.uk/research" target="_blank">More recent research projects and centres from the Faculty of History</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78821" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image image-thumbnail align-right">
        <a href="http://www.history.ox.ac.uk">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_thumbnail/public/humanities/images/page/History%20Logo_2.jpg?itok=28XEpzum" alt="History Faculty logo" /></a></div>
<p class="rtecenter">For more information, visit the History Faculty website</p>
<hr /><p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Undergraduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/courses-listing?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Graduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/graduate/courses/courses-by-department?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Research</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.history.ox.ac.uk/research" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Academic staff</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.history.ox.ac.uk/people" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<hr /></div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>

      <section class="col-sm-9">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Faculty of Linguistics, Philology and Phonetics</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-basic-page node-82956"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-9 col-lg-9"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-60641" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p>Established in 2008 (but looking back to several centuries of linguistic studies at Oxford), the Faculty of Linguistics, Philology and Phonetics is the youngest Faculty within the Humanities Division. With its research and teaching profile which encompasses Theoretical Linguistics, Experimental Linguistics, and Historical and Comparative Linguistics it offers a uniquely stimulating and diverse academic environment. Among its 20 postholders there are specialists in Phonology, Phonetics, Semantics, Syntax, Psycholinguistics, Sociolinguistics, the linguistics of all major European languages, as well as Classical and Indo-European Comparative Philology.</p>
<p>The Faculty is housed in the Centre for Linguistics and Philology, which occupies part of the former Clarendon Press Institute on the east side of Walton Street. Most graduate courses in Linguistics and Philology are held in the building, and offices for both academic and administrative staff are also located here; facilities for graduate students include a common room, computer workstations and printing and photocopying equipment.</p>
<p>The Faculty also maintains two Laboratories for experimental research, the Language and Brain Laboratory for Psycholinguistics and Neurolinguistics and the Phonetics Laboratory. Both of these are situated in a separate building in the immediate vicinity of the Centre for Linguistics and Philology.</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78891" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>Teaching and Research Showcase</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Book: Lexical Processing of Speech (Aditi Lahiri, 2017)</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="https://www.amazon.co.uk/Lexical-Processing-Speech-Phonology-Phonetics/dp/3110425734/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1484312879&amp;s">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/lexical.jpg?itok=XPBCJSD9" alt="Lexical Processing of Speech (Phonology and Phonetics) " /></a></div>
<div id="byline">Professor Lahiri is Professor of Linguistics and Fellow of Somerville College and she studies Phonology, phonetics, historical linguistics, psycholinguistics, neurolinguistics.</div>
<div> </div>
<div><a href="http://www.ling-phil.ox.ac.uk/publications" target="_blank">More publications from the Faculty of Linguistics, Philology and Phonetics</a></div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78896" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Research Project: Language and Brain Laboratory </h4>
<p>The Language and Brain Laboratory was established in 2008 as part of the Faculty of Linguistics, Philology and Phonetics. It is an active research laboratory covering all aspects of linguistics, including phonology, morphology, syntax and semantics. Research members in this laboratory are engaged in theoretical as well as experimental research covering psycholinguistic and neurolinguistic methodology.</p>
<p><a href="http://brainlab.clp.ox.ac.uk/" target="_blank">http://brainlab.clp.ox.ac.uk/ </a></p>
<p><a href="http://www.ling-phil.ox.ac.uk/research" target="_blank">More research projects and centres from the Faculty of Linguistics, Philology and Phonetics</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-74126" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-png embed-image image-thumbnail align-center">
        <a href="http://www.ling-phil.ox.ac.uk/index.php?section=1">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_thumbnail/public/humanities/images/page/linquistics_logo.png?itok=KKWUZkZJ" alt="Faculty of Linguistics, Philology and Phonetics" /></a></div>
<p class="rtecenter">For more information, visit the Linguistics, Philology &amp; Phonetics Faculty website</p>
<hr /><p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Undergraduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/courses-listing?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Graduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/graduate/courses/courses-by-department?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Research</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.ling-phil.ox.ac.uk/research" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Academic staff</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.ling-phil.ox.ac.uk/postholders" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
    </div>
  
  </div>
</div>
</section>
  </div>
      </section>

</ul></li>

      <section class="col-sm-9">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Faculty of Medieval and Modern Languages</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-basic-page node-82971"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-9 col-lg-9"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-60646" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p>The Faculty is one of the leading centres for the study of European language, literature, and culture world-wide, offering expertise in the entire chronological range from the earliest times to the present day, and with specialists in film studies, cultural studies, history of the book, and cultural history as well as languages and literatures. The Faculty offers expertise in French, German, Italian, Modern Greek, Spanish, Portuguese, Russian, Polish and Czech, as well as in a range of other languages spoken in Europe. Colleagues across the various languages work together in various interdisciplinary projects and research centres, which bring specialists in language and literature together with historians, philosophers, and social studies scholars.</p>
<p>The Faculty is divided into seven sub-faculties: French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Russian and other Slavonic Languages, Spanish and Modern Greek. It includes 9 established professorships as well as 15 individuals with the title of professor and 80 permanent academic post holders. The colleges, which are responsible for undergraduate admissions and undergraduate tutorial teaching, admit a total of about 270 students a year to read for the Honour School of Modern Languages and its joint schools with Classics, English, History, Philosophy, Oriental Studies, and Linguistics. The Modern Languages Faculty Board is responsible for the admission and supervision of graduate students. There are about 60 graduates taking taught Masters degrees, and about 120 research students.</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78901" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>Teaching and Research Showcase</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Podcast: Mesoamerican Manuscripts</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/series/mesoamerican-manuscripts">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/mesoamerican-manuscripts.jpg?itok=zQsYQ0PR" alt="Mesoamerican Manuscripts" /></a></div>
<p>This conference brings together an outstanding panel of scholars and experts in Mesoamerican studies. They will be sharing their knowledge and recent findings on the making and historical significance of the Bodleian's and other early, pictorial Mesoamerican manuscripts, situating them in the context of the pre-Columbian and colonial societies that produced them, describing the world they depict, and reflecting upon their meaning in contemporary Mexico and beyond.</p>
<p><a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/series/mesoamerican-manuscripts" target="_blank">More podcasts from the Faculty of Medieval and Modern Languages</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78906" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Book: Blindness and the Enlightenment (Kate Tunstall, 2011)</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
            <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/tunstall-blindness.jpg?itok=hM7rDfzo" alt="Kate Tunstall, Blindness" /></div>
<p>Blindness and Enlightenment presents a reading and a new translation of Diderot’s Letter on the Blind. Diderot was the editor of the Encyclopédie, that Trojan horse of Enlightenment ideas, as well as a novelist, playwright, art critic and philosopher. His Letter on the Blind of 1749 is essential reading for anyone interested in Enlightenment philosophy or eighteenth-century literature because it contradicts a central assumption of Western literature and philosophy, and of the Enlightenment in particular, namely that moral and philosophical insight is dependent on seeing. Kate Tunstall’s essay guides the reader through the Letter, its anecdotes, ideas and its conversational mode of presenting them, and it situates the Letter in relation both to the Encyclopedie and to a rich tradition of writing about and, most importantly, talking and listening to the blind.</p>
<p><a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/books" target="_blank">More publications from the Faculty of Medieval and Modern Languages</a></p>
<p>Find publications in different languages: <a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/books/french" target="_blank">French</a>, <a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/books/german" target="_blank">German</a>, <a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/books/spanish" target="_blank">Spanish</a>,<a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/books/italian" target="_blank"> Italian</a>, <a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/books/russian" target="_blank">Russian</a>, <a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/books/portuguese" target="_blank">Portuguese</a>, <a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/books/modern-greek" target="_blank">Modern Greek</a>, <a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/books/czech" target="_blank">Czech</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78911" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Research Project: The Venetian Book-trade in the 15th Century: material evidence for the economic and social history of the Renaissance</h4>
<div>
<div class="file file-image file-image-png embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/research/venetian-book-trade-15th-century-material-evidence-for-economic-social-history-renaissanc">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/study_book.png?itok=ZTH1OND6" alt="Study of the Book" /></a></div>
<p>This project proposes for the first time to use the traded objects themselves, 15th-century books which still survive in their thousands, as essential and unquestionable evidence of the booktrade, to substantially complement current research on the booktrade based almost solely on scattered documentary evidence (printers contracts, litigations, booksellers stock lists, wills etc.).</p>
<div><a href="http://www.bodley.ox.ac.uk/csb/Projects_Venetian_Incunables.htm" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);" target="_blank">http://www.bodley.ox.ac.uk/csb/Projects_Venetian_Incunables.htm</a></div>
<div> </div>
<div><a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/research" target="_blank">More research projects and centres from the Faculty of Medieval and Modern Languages</a></div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-74131" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-png embed-image image-thumbnail align-right">
        <a href="http:// http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/ ">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_thumbnail/public/humanities/images/page/mml_logo.png?itok=SayNnhUc" alt="Faculty of Medieval and Modern Languages" /></a></div>
<p class="rtecenter">For more information, visit the Medieval and Modern Languages Faculty website</p>
<hr /><p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Undergraduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/courses-listing?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Graduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/graduate/courses/courses-by-department?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Research</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/research" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Academic staff</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.mod-langs.ox.ac.uk/people" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>

<li class="expanded menu-mlid-18666"><a href="/research"><span>Research</span></a><ul class="menu nav navbar-nav"><li class="first last expanded menu-mlid-22776"><a href="/early-career-opportunities"><span>Early Career Opportunities</span></a><ul class="menu nav navbar-nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-24306"><a href="/british-academy-postdoctoral-fellowships"><span>British Academy Postdoctoral Fellowships</span></a></li>
<li class="last leaf menu-mlid-24311"><a href="/leverhulme-trust-early-career-fellowships"><span>Leverhulme Trust Early Career Fellowships</span></a></li>
</ul></li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-mlid-21586"><a href="/get-involved"><span>Get Involved</span></a><ul class="menu nav navbar-nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-23726"><a href="/alumni"><span>Alumni</span></a></li>

</ul></li>
