      <section class="col-sm-9">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Faculty of Classics</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-basic-page node-82936"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-9 col-lg-9"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-77671" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
            <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/page/st_giles_66_-classics_233-470x353.jpg?itok=QVU78hLA" alt="Faculty of Classics" /></div>
<p>The Faculty of Classics encompasses research and teaching in all aspects of ancient Greece and Rome, and their neighbours. Specialisms of Faculty members include the economic, social and political history of the ancient cultures, their mythology, science, art, archaeology, thought and and literature, and their reception in other periods. The Faculty is home to the sub-Faculties of Classical Languages and Literature and Ancient History and Classical Archaeology, and a number of internationally renowned research projects including the Beazley Archive, the Lexicon of Greek Personal Names, and Oxyrynchus Papyri.</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-77771" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>Teaching and Research Showcase</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Podcast: Greek and Roman Drama - Theatre History &amp; Modern Performance (APGRD Public Lectures)</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/series/greek-and-roman-drama-theatre-history-modern-performance-apgrd-public-lectures">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/greek-and-roman-drama-theatre-history-modern-performance-apgrd-public-lectures_0.jpg?itok=jWEMJX9X" alt="Greek and Roman Drama Podcast" /></a></div>
<p>Podcasts of the lectures and in-conversation events with acclaimed actors, directors, playwrights, and academics, on modern and historic performances inspired by ancient Greek and Roman texts - hosted by the Archive of Performances of Greek and Roman Drama. For upcoming public events please visit the APGRD website.</p>
<p><a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/units/faculty-classics" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);" target="_blank">More podcasts relating to the Faculty of Classics.</a></p>
<p> </p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-77776" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Book: Writing Biography in Greece and Rome: Narrative Technique and Fictionalization (edited by Koen De Temmerman and Kristoffel Demoen, 2016)</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
            <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/classics_book.jpg?itok=ZYvNbTr5" alt="Writing Biography in Greece and Rome: Narrative Technique and Fictionalization " /></div>
<p>Ancient biography is now a well-established and popular field of study among classicists as well as many scholars of literature and history more generally. In particular biographies offer important insights into the dynamics underlying ancient performance of the self and social behaviour, issues currently of crucial importance in classical studies. <span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">They also raise complex issues of narrativity and fictionalization. This volume examines a range of ancient texts which are or purport to be biographical and explores how formal narrative categories such as time, space and character are constructed and how they address (highlight, question, thematize, underscore or problematize) the borderline between historicity and fictionality. In doing so, it makes a major contribution not only to the study of ancient biographical writing but also to broader narratological approaches to ancient texts.</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.classics.ox.ac.uk/publications.html" target="_blank">More Publications from the Faculty of Classics.</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78846" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Research Project: Anachronism and Antiquity</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small-square align-left">
            <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small_square/public/humanities/images/media/anachronism_and_antiquity.jpg?itok=Kye8x_nT" alt="Nausicca" /></div>
<p>This Leverhulme Trust-funded project, running from 2016 to 2019, is undertaking the first systematic study of the concept of anachronism in Greco-Roman antiquity and of the role played by the idea of anachronism in the formation of the concept of antiquity itself.</p>
<p>The project, led by Professor Tim Rood and Professor John Marincola, looks at both classical and modern material, pairing close analysis of surviving literary and material evidence from classical antiquity with detailed study of the post-classical term ‘anachronism’, and with modern theoretical writings that link the notion of anachronism with the conceptualization of antiquity. </p>
<p><a href="http://www.classics.ox.ac.uk/research.html" target="_blank">More Research Projects and Centres from the Faculty of Classics</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-77691" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image image-thumbnail align-right">
        <a href="http://www.classics.ox.ac.uk/">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_thumbnail/public/humanities/images/media/classics.jpg?itok=66zYiRYh" alt="Faculty of Classics Logo" /></a></div>
<p class="rtecenter">For more information, visit the Classics Faculty website</p>
<hr /><p><strong>Undergraduate courses</strong></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/courses-listing?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><strong>Graduate courses</strong></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/graduate/courses/courses-by-department?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><strong>Research</strong></p>
<p><a href="http://www.classics.ox.ac.uk/research.html" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<p><strong>Academic staff</strong></p>
<p><a href="http://www.classics.ox.ac.uk/people.html" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
    </div>
  
  </div>
</div>
</section>
  </div>
      </section>

            
    </div>

</ul></li>
</ul></li>
<li class="expanded menu-mlid-21586"><a href="/get-involved"><span>Get Involved</span></a><ul class="menu nav navbar-nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-23726"><a href="/alumni"><span>Alumni</span></a></li>

</ul></li>

      <section class="col-sm-9">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Faculty of English Language and Literature</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-basic-page node-82916"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-9 col-lg-9"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-59016" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p>Oxford’s English Faculty is the largest in Britain, and one of the most illustrious Schools of English in the world. Established in 1894, it has numbered among its members some of the most important critics and scholars in the field, including J.R.R. Tolkien, C.S. Lewis, Edmund Blunden, Nevill Coghill, Helen Gardner, Richard Ellmann, Terry Eagleton, and many others.</p>
<p>We are now home to nearly eighty Professors, Readers, and Lecturers, with about the same number again of Tutors and Research Fellows based in Colleges. At any one time, there are roughly a thousand students studying within the Faculty at undergraduate level, and another three hundred at graduate level in the largest English graduate school in the country.</p>
<p>Traditionally teaching and research in the Faculty has covered the entire history of literature in English from the Anglo-Saxon period to the present day, along with language studies. More recent growth areas include world literature and film studies.</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78856" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>Teaching and Research Showcase</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4 style="font-family: &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">Podcast: Approaching Shakespere</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/series/approaching-shakespeare">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/approaching-shakespeare.jpg?itok=KjRQM2wE" alt="Approaching Shakespeare Podcasts" /></a></div>
<p>Each lecture in this series focuses on a single play by Shakespeare, and employs a range of different approaches to try to understand a central critical question about it. Rather than providing overarching readings or interpretations, the series aims to show the variety of different ways we might understand Shakespeare, the kinds of evidence that might be used to strengthen our critical analysis, and, above all, the enjoyable and unavoidable fact that Shakespeare's plays tend to generate our questions rather than answer them.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom: 10px;"><a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/units/faculty-english-language-and-literature" target="_blank">More podcasts relating to the Faculty of English Language and Literature.</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78861" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Book: The Long, Long Life of Trees (Fiona Stafford, 2016)</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="http://www.english.ox.ac.uk/article/long-long-life-trees">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/long_life_of_trees.jpg?itok=A1dsgoVO" alt="The Long Life of Trees" /></a></div>
<p>Fiona Stafford explores the various relationships between human lifestyles and trees, from mytholody to medicine. Facts and fables around seventeen common trees are explored, and the uses of wood, the importance of trees in slowing climate change, and the threats of tree diseases are all discussed in a rich book filled with unusual and fascinating facts.</p>
<p><a href="http://www.english.ox.ac.uk/recent-publications" target="_blank">More Publications from the Faculty of English Language and Literature.</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78866" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Research Cluster: War, Literature and Culture</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="http://www.english.ox.ac.uk/war-literature-and-culture#tab-1-0">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/battle_of_germany.jpg?itok=PAhKAgud" alt="The Battle of Germany: Paul Nash, used under the Imperial War Museum non-commercial licence." /></a></div>
<p>The War, Literature, Culture research cluster brings together academics from across the English Faculty and acts as a point of contact for those outside it.  Our research ranges from the medieval period to the 21st century.  We explore the intersection of war with literature and culture in a variety of areas: language, genre, gender, editing, life-writing, travel-writing, digitisation, commemoration, journalism, visual representation, religion and literary theory.</p>
<p><a href="http://www.english.ox.ac.uk/research-projects" target="_blank">More Research Projects and Centres from the Faculty of English Language and Literature.</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-74116" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image image-thumbnail align-right">
        <a href="https://www.english.ox.ac.uk/home">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_thumbnail/public/humanities/images/media/English%20Logo.jpg?itok=FmyMqOOQ" alt="English Faculty logo" /></a></div>
<p class="rtecenter">For more information, visit the English Language &amp; Literature Faculty website</p>
<hr /><p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Undergraduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/courses-listing?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Graduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/graduate/courses/courses-by-department?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Research</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.english.ox.ac.uk/our-research" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Academic staff</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.english.ox.ac.uk/people" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<hr /></div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
    </div>
  
  </div>
</div>
</section>
  </div>
      </section>

</ul></li>
</ul></div>

</section>

  <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-sidebar_nav menu-name-menu-og-7716 parent-mlid-18656 menu-level-1">

      <section class="col-sm-9">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Faculty of History</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-basic-page node-68021"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-9 col-lg-9"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-53121" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
            <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/72.dpi_.jpg?itok=g42DKxBw" alt="History Faculty Building" /></div>
<p>Medieval and modern history has been studied at Oxford for longer than at almost any other university: a Regius Professor of Modern History was first appointed in 1724, and undergraduate examinations began in 1850.</p>
<p>The History Faculty has more than 90 permanent academic staff. Of these, 15 are statutory Professors, or Readers. The majority of permanent academic staff, are joint appointees whose teaching responsibilities encompass both the Faculty and the individual college of appointment.</p>
<p> The Faculty also encompasses at any one time a number of historians employed by colleges – College Lecturers and short-term Junior Research Fellows – as well as those on fixed-term employment with the Faculty: Departmental Lecturers providing teaching for postholders on research leave, and research assistants on funded research projects. Its wider membership includes colleagues in a number of other faculties and departments across the University who work as historians or in closely cognate disciplines.</p>
<p>The University of Oxford is one of the world's most encompassing centres for the study of history. The faculty has nearly twelve hundred undergraduates, and almost five hundred graduate students attracted from around the world.</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78871" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>Teaching and Research Showcase</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Podcast: The English People at War in the Age of Henry VIII</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/series/english-people-war-age-henry-viii">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/english-people-war-age-henry-viii_0.jpg?itok=NqDRyyv-" alt="podcast: English People at war in the time of Henry VIII" /></a></div>
<p>In this history lecture series Professor Stephen Gunn look at the effects of war on the people of England in the 1500s. This lecture series was recorded in Hilary Term 2015 and is part of the annual James Ford Lectures in British History series at the Examination Schools in Oxford University.</p>
<p><a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/units/faculty-history" target="_blank">More podcasts relating to the Faculty of History</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78876" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Book: Martin Luther: Renegade and Prophet (Lyndal Roper, 2016)</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="https://www.history.ox.ac.uk/article/lyndal-roper-martin-luther-renegade-and-prophet-bodley-head">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/luther.jpg?itok=eM8JWYru" alt="Martin Luther: Renegade and Prophet" /></a></div>
<p>When Martin Luther nailed a sheet of paper to the church door of a small university town on 31 October 1517, he set off a process that changed the Western world for ever.</p>
<p>Luther’s ideas spread like wildfire. His attack on the Church soon convulsed Germany, divided Europe and polarised people’s beliefs. They triggered decades of religious persecution, social unrest and war. And in the long run, his ideas paradoxically helped break the grip of religion in every sphere of life.</p>
<p>But the man who started the Reformation was deeply flawed. He was a religious fundamentalist, a Jew-hater and a political reactionary. He was a fervent believer who was tormented by doubt, a brilliant writer who shaped the German language and a vicious and foul-mouthed polemicist. He was a married ex-monk who liberated human sexuality from the stigma of sin, but also a man who insisted that women should know their place. For him the Devil was not just a figure of speech but a very real and physical presence. </p>
<p>In this first historical biography for many decades, distinguished historian Lyndal Roper gives us a flesh-and-blood figure, warts and all. She reveals the often contradictory psychological forces that drove Luther forward – insecurity and self-righteousness, anger and humility – and the dynamics they unleashed which turned a small act of protest into a battle against the power of the Church.</p>
<p><a href="https://history.web.ox.ac.uk/recent-publications" target="_blank">More publications from the Faculty of History</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78881" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Project Centre: The Global History Centre</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="http://www.history.ox.ac.uk/oxford-centre-global-history">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/cd_research_oxford_centre_for_global_history.jpg?itok=OYh_OqQy" alt="Oxford Centre for Global History" /></a></div>
<p>The Oxford Centre for Global History was established by the History Faculty in June 2011 to reflect its strong commitment to the field. Global History in Oxford is defined broadly as the global movement of people, goods, and ideas and the consequences that flow from them. Chronologically, it extends across all historical periods from ancient to late modern.</p>
<p>The Centre is particularly keen to encourage cooperation between historians of different periods, as well as places, in the study of themes of global significance. It will support research projects, and host workshops, seminars, and conferences. A key part of the Centre’s role is to facilitate the research of all those in Oxford who are keen to develop a global history dimension in their work. </p>
<p><strong><a href="http://global.history.ox.ac.uk/" target="_blank">http://global.history.ox.ac.uk</a></strong></p>
<p><a href="http://www.history.ox.ac.uk/research" target="_blank">More recent research projects and centres from the Faculty of History</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78821" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image image-thumbnail align-right">
        <a href="http://www.history.ox.ac.uk">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_thumbnail/public/humanities/images/page/History%20Logo_2.jpg?itok=28XEpzum" alt="History Faculty logo" /></a></div>
<p class="rtecenter">For more information, visit the History Faculty website</p>
<hr /><p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Undergraduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/courses-listing?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Graduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/graduate/courses/courses-by-department?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Research</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.history.ox.ac.uk/research" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Academic staff</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.history.ox.ac.uk/people" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<hr /></div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="panelizer-view-mode paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-full paragraphs-item-related-content paragraphs-item-130011 margin-bottom" id="panelizer-item-130011" >
        <div class="panel-flexible panels-flexible-new clearfix" >
<div class="panel-flexible-inside panels-flexible-new-inside">
<div class="panels-flexible-region panels-flexible-region-new-center panels-flexible-region-first panels-flexible-region-last">
  <div class="inside panels-flexible-region-inside panels-flexible-region-new-center-inside panels-flexible-region-inside-first panels-flexible-region-inside-last">
<div class="panel-pane pane-views-panes pane-related-content-panel-pane-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    <div class="view view-related-content view-id-related_content view-display-id-panel_pane_2 view-dom-id-e63bf9921f8f66c0d2c9c7ae86d8f846">
        
  
  
      <div 
   class="view-content row">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 first-in-row last-in-row views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 items-per-row-1 thumbnail-row">
    <a href="/cultures-of-knowledge">
  <article about="/cultures-of-knowledge" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document" class="node node-oxdrupal-basic-page node--oxdrupal_basic_page--thumbnail_row listing-style-thumbnail-row">
                <img typeof="foaf:Image" class="img-responsive" src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/thumbnail_row_image/public/history/images/page/Cultures%20of%20Knowledge.jpg?itok=sSGG_U9-" width="100" height="100" alt="Cultures of Knowledge" title="Cultures of Knowledge" />
    
        <div class="thumbnail-panel-title">
            <h3>Cultures of Knowledge</h3>
        </div>
                                    
    <div class="clearfix"></div>
  </article>
  <div class="listing-spacer thumbnail-row-spacer"></div>
</a>
  </div>

  <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-sidebar_nav menu-name-menu-og-7716 parent-mlid-18656 menu-level-1">

      <section class="col-sm-9">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Faculty of Music</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-basic-page node-82981"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-9 col-lg-9"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-60651" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p>The Oxford University Music Faculty is one of the largest and liveliest music departments in the UK. As an internationally renowned centre of teaching and research in all aspects of music, it is an exciting and stimulating environment in which to work and study.</p>
<p>Our undergraduate and graduate curricula are strong in traditional musicological and musical skills – for musicologists, performers and composers – but are also notably wide-ranging and imaginative. They reflect the spectrum of contemporary developments in music and musicology: from the 13th-century motet to global hip-hop; from ethnomusicology to music psychology; from historically informed performance practice to electroacoustic composition. Alongside our formal programmes, we organise a wide variety of concerts, masterclasses, workshops, public lectures and conferences. Our resources include the celebrated Bate Collection of Musical Instruments, a high-spec electronic music studio, a prize-winning library, an Indonesian gamelan and specialised resources for the study of performance. Students work closely with our resident ensembles, which include the Orchestra of the Age of the Enlightenment, the Cavaleri String Quartet and Contrapunctus. And all this is complemented by the exceptionally rich musical and academic life of the wider University and its colleges, with world-famous choirs, University orchestras and chamber groups, jazz and contemporary music ensembles, as well as the unrivalled resources of the Bodleian Library.</p>
<p>Our research, too, covers a broad spectrum, including European music from 800 to the present day, ethnomusicology, composition, opera studies, film and popular musics, music theory and analysis, the psychology of music and performance studies. The Faculty is home to the European Research Council’s €1.7m research centre, Music, Digitization, Mediation: Towards Interdisciplinary Music Studies. And our own work is greatly enriched by a roster of regular visitors from the worlds of musicology, performance and composition, and from the wider professional musical world.</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78916" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>Teaching and Research Showcase</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Podcast: Unlocking Late Schumann</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/series/unlocking-late-schumann">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/unlocking-late-schumann.jpg?itok=hIwSrM4p" alt="Unlocking late schumann" /></a></div>
<p>In this series TORCH Knowledge Exchange Fellow, Professor Laura Tunbridge from the Faculty of Music, introduces music by German Romantic composer Robert Schumann, focusing particularly on the late works being featured in the Oxford Lieder Festival (14-29 October, 2016). Prof. Tunbridge discusses the challenges of performing and interpreting this music with Professor Barry Murnane and Richard Wigmore, and performers Sarah Connolly, James Gilchrist, Tim Horton, Eugene Asti, and Roger Vignoles.</p>
<p><a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/units/faculty-music" target="_blank">More podcasts from the Faculty of Music</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-78926" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Research: Balzan Research Project, Towards a global history of music</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="http://www.music.ox.ac.uk/research/projects/balzan-research-project/">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/banner-piano2-210x135.jpg?itok=EtgxG5MP" alt="balzan research project" /></a></div>
<p>The idea of a global history of music, which may be traced back to enlightenment forerunners, and has been reiterated in the 1970s by the music historian Leo Treitler, among others. The present situation in various branches of western musicology is characterised by specialisation – on European music history on the one hand, on ethnological or sociological fieldwork on the other. Research on specific musical cultures sometimes lacks comparative outreach or is insufficiently reflected in the wider discipline. The historical depth of other civilisations is often underrated by western scholarship, and a concern for the world’s musical past, shared with non-western speakers, is rarely visible.</p>
<p>Postcolonial critique has challenged the West’s self-ascribed position at the heart of world history. In the light of this challenge, how might a historical understanding of western music in the world proceed? How should it position, or justify itself? Who might be authorised to speak for, or against, it? What would ‘western music’ look like in an account of music history that aspired to be truly global?</p>
<p><a href="http://www.music.ox.ac.uk/research/projects/" target="_blank">More research projects and centres from the Faculty of Music</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-74136" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image image-thumbnail align-right">
        <a href="https://www.music.ox.ac.uk/">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_thumbnail/public/humanities/images/media/music_logo_single.jpg?itok=WTpbhbFY" alt="Faculty of Music Logo" /></a></div>
<p class="rtecenter">For more information, visit the Music Faculty website</p>
<hr /><p><strong>Events</strong></p>
<p><a href="http://www.music.ox.ac.uk/events/" target="_blank">http://www.music.ox.ac.uk/events/</a> </p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Undergraduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/courses-listing?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Graduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/graduate/courses/courses-by-department?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Research</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.music.ox.ac.uk/research/projects/" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Academic staff</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.music.ox.ac.uk/about/people/academic-staff/university-lecturers-and-college-fellows/" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
    </div>
  
  </div>
</div>
</section>
  </div>
      </section>

        <div id="footer" class="container">
      <div class="row">
          <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-site-footer node-7746"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-fourcol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-1"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">

  <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-sidebar_nav menu-name-menu-og-7716 parent-mlid-18656 menu-level-1">

      <section class="col-sm-9">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Faculty of Oriental Studies</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-basic-page node-82991"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-9 col-lg-9"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-60656" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p>Among subjects in the Humanities, Oriental Studies is unique in introducing students to cultures and civilisations that do not usually form part of the mainstream curriculum in British schools. The courses present both the major traditions of the regions studied and, in most cases, their modern developments. All courses include language, literature, history and culture,and there are a wide range of options in such fields as art and archaeology, history, literature, philosophy, religion and modern social studies.The following are the principal areas of study: Islamic World, Hebrew and Jewish Studies, Eastern Christianity, Egyptology and Ancient Near East, South and Inner Asia and East As<a href="http://www.orinst.ox.ac.uk/ea/index.html">i</a>an Studies.</p>
<p>In addition to the above subject areas, a major benefaction from the Bukkyo Dendo Kyokai has fully endowed a new Chair of Buddhist Studies at Oxford.</p>
<p>Oriental Studies has a long history in Oxford. The Bodleian and other libraries have acquired magnificent collections. The Oriental Institute, Bodleian Japanese, Indian Institute, Bodleian K B Chen China Centre Libraries, and the Leopold Muller Memorial Library for Hebrew and Jewish Studies, offer loan collections in their respective fields. Adjacent to the Oriental Institute is the Ashmolean Museum, which houses superb collections. The Sackler Library includes the principal library for Egyptology and Ancient Near Eastern Studies.</p>
<p>Most courses offer the opportunity to spend time in the region being studied. The Arabic courseincludes a year in the Middle East, the Persian and Turkish courses a year in Iran or Turkey respectively, the Hebrew course an optional year in Israel. Both the Chinese and Japanese coursesinclude a year abroad for all undergraduates in their second year, where they attend a course at a university which has been especially designed for Oxford’s undergraduates.</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-79056" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>Teaching and Research Showcase</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Podcast: Ancient Egypt</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/series/ancient-egypt">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/ancient-egypt.jpg?itok=VyJV_qpZ" alt="Oriental Studies Podcasts" /></a></div>
<p>Lectures and workshops on the study and research of Ancient Egypt and Egyptology.</p>
<p><a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/units/faculty-oriental-studies" target="_blank">More podcasts from the Faculty of Oriental Studies</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-79021" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4 id="page-title">Research Project: Oxford Early Modern South Asia Project, Specialist knowledges, networks and agencies of change</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="http://www.orinst.ox.ac.uk/research/oxford_early_modern_south_asia_project.html">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/gopuram-tower-entrance-hindu-temple-varanasi.jpg?itok=ak5doXqa" alt="gopuram tower entrance hindu temple varanasi" /></a></div>
<p>Recent research in the history of early modern South Asia has emphasized its remarkable commercial, political and cultural successes. By the middle of the seventeenth century the region had emerged as the world’s premiere exporter of craft manufactures. Externally, the Mughal imperial state had established itself as a major player in the exchanges between Asia’s emerging ‘universal’ empires, and within the region had devised a framework of rule effective in its ability to incorporate regional power-holders in return for support for their own local authority. The region was also home to an extraordinarily fertile linguistic and literary landscape, in which regional vernaculars flourished and in a complex interplay with the cosmopolitan languages of Persian and Sanskrit. Underpinning these changes and linking together the worlds of court and household, temple and lodge, market, manufactory and military camp, were developing networks of specialists - service and scribal people - who constituted a vital resource as much in the households of local elites as at the courts of imperial and regional states.</p>
<p><a href="http://www.orinst.ox.ac.uk/research/research.html" target="_blank">More research projects and centres from the Faculty of Oriental Studies</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-74141" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image image-thumbnail align-right">
        <a href="http://www.orinst.ox.ac.uk/ ">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_thumbnail/public/humanities/images/media/oriental_studies.jpg?itok=33LYmcBG" alt="Oriental studies" title="Oriental studies" /></a></div>
<p class="rtecenter">For more information, visit the Oriental Studies website</p>
<hr /><p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Undergraduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/courses-listing?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Graduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/graduate/courses/courses-by-department?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Research</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.orinst.ox.ac.uk/research/research.html" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Academic staff</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.orinst.ox.ac.uk/staff/academicstaff.html" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<p> </p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
    </div>
  
  </div>
</div>
</section>
  </div>
      </section>

  <!-- REGION FOOTER TOP -->
  <div id="wrapper-footer" class="wrapper">
        <div id="footer" class="container">
      <div class="row">
          <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-site-footer node-7746"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-fourcol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-1"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-1 paragraphs-items-field-region-1-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-1 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-47436" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>INFORMATION ABOUT</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/about/organisation?wssl=1" target="_blank">Oxford University</a></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/research?wssl=1" target="_blank">Oxford's Research</a></p>
<p><a href="http://www.ox.ac.uk/node/1783/" target="_blank">Fees and funding</a></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/research/libraries?wssl=1" target="_blank">Libraries</a></p>

      <section class="col-sm-9">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Faculty of Philosophy</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-basic-page node-82931"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-9 col-lg-9"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-60661" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p>Oxford is one of the world's great centres for philosophy. There are over 50 full-time permanent members of the Faculty of Philosophy, each with a college Fellowship, together with a still larger number of associate members, between them covering a vast range of subjects within philosophy.</p>
<p>Many are international leaders in their fields. The Faculty of Philosophy is one of the largest departments of philosophy in the world, and is widely recognized to be amongst the best.</p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-79061" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>Teaching and Research Showcase</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Podcast: Metaphor, Philosophical Issues</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/series/metaphor-philosophical-issues">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/metaphor-philosophical-issues.jpg?itok=PCC8_TyN" alt="metaphor-philosophical-issues" /></a></div>
<p>Lecture series introducing some of the main debates about metaphor in contemporary aesthetics and philosophy of language. No background in either philosophy of language or aesthetics is required. Questions considered include: Are there some thoughts that can only be expressed in metaphor? Why do we speak metaphorically, especially in describing how things look, sound, taste and smell? How do metaphors get the special meaning or content they have? And do metaphors have a non-literal meaning or content at all?</p>
<p><a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/units/faculty-philosophy" target="_blank">More Podcasts from the Faculty of Philosophy</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-81441" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Publication: Professor Elizabeth Fricker, ‘Unreliable Testimony’, in Alvin Goldman and his Critics. Brian McLaughlin and Hilary Kornblith (eds.). Blackwell (2014)</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
            <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/philosophy_book.jpg?itok=HAxl_uHB" alt="Goldman and his critics" /></div>
<p class="rteindent2">Goldman and His Critics presents a series of original essays contributed by influential philosophers who critically examine Alvin Goldman s work, followed by Goldman s responses to each essay. </p>
<ul><li class="rteindent2">Critiques Alvin Goldmans groundbreaking theories, writings, and ideas on a range of philosophical topics</li>
<li class="rteindent2">Features contributions from some of the most important and influential contemporary philosophers</li>
<li class="rteindent2">Covers Goldmans views on epistemology both individual and social in addition to cognitive science and metaphysics</li>
<li class="rteindent2">Pays special attention to Goldmans writings on philosophy of mind, including the evolution of his thoughts on Simulation–Theory (ST)</li>
</ul><p><a href="http://www.philosophy.ox.ac.uk/faculty-members" target="_blank"> More Publications from the Faculty of Philosophy</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-79066" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Research Project: The Metaphysics of Entanglement</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="http://www.metaphysics-of-entanglement.ox.ac.uk/home">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/higgs.jpg?itok=G3VW5Pfs" alt="Higgs" /></a></div>
<p>This is a multidisciplinary research Project investigating the viability of power ontology as a metaphysics that can provide a fresh approach to our philosophical understanding of the phenomena of entanglement and superposition. </p>
<p><a href="http://www.philosophy.ox.ac.uk/research" target="_blank">More research projects and centres from the Faculty of Philosophy</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-74146" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image image-thumbnail align-right">
        <a href="http://www.philosophy.ox.ac.uk/">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_thumbnail/public/humanities/images/page/philosophy_logo.jpg?itok=wTPxl4gJ" alt="Faculty of Philosophy" /></a></div>
<p class="rtecenter">For more information, visit the Philosophy Faculty website</p>
<hr /><p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Undergraduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/courses-listing?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Graduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/graduate/courses/courses-by-department?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Research</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.philosophy.ox.ac.uk/research" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Academic staff</span></p>
<p><a href="http://www.philosophy.ox.ac.uk/people" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<hr /></div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>

    </div>

</section>

        <div class="bootstrap-fourcol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-1"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-1 paragraphs-items-field-region-1-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-1 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-47436" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>INFORMATION ABOUT</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/about/organisation?wssl=1" target="_blank">Oxford University</a></p>

  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel second col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-47441" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>INFORMATION FOR</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate?wssl=1" target="_blank">Prospective undergraduates</a></p>
<p><a href="http://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/graduate" target="_blank">Prospective graduate students</a></p>

      <section class="col-sm-9">
        
        <div id="main-content"></div>

                          <h1 class="page-header row ">Faculty of Theology and Religion</h1>
                                                          <div class="region region-content">
    <section id="block-system-main" class="block block-system clearfix">

      
  <div class="panelizer-view-mode node node-full node-oxdrupal-basic-page node-82926"  >
        <div class="bootstrap-twocol-stacked" >
  
      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-9 col-lg-9"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-74176" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><p>Theology is one of the oldest faculties in this ancient University. One of the first courses of lectures given at Oxford was in Theology, over 800 years ago. Alexander Neckam, from St Albans, is recorded as giving biblical and moral lectures as early as 1193, on the Psalms of David and the Wisdom of Solomon. One of the first major University buildings (still intact and recently described as ‘the loveliest room in England') was the Divinity School, which was begun in 1423 to cater for Theology lectures. So we have a long history behind us, of which Oxford's beautiful setting and many historic buildings remind us.</p>
<p>Nevertheless, we are very much aware that present and future success cannot rest on past achievements. Recent developments include our work in the <a href="https://www.theology.ox.ac.uk/study-religions" target="_blank">Study of Religion</a> and in the major religious traditions of the world, and also our exploration of the interface between <a href="https://www.theology.ox.ac.uk/science-and-religion" target="_blank">science and religion</a>.</p>
<p>At the heart of the Faculty of Theology and Religion are those who hold full-time permanent positions and who have a particular responsibility for teaching, research and the delivery of the syllabus, as well as academic leadership. These University postholders number 23 in all; they are Professors and University Lecturers. Each is attached to a College: some have greater responsibilities to undergraduates, and others to graduates. But the Faculty is further enriched by its 100 or so other members; they include research fellows and College chaplains, lecturers and tutors, and they are involved in teaching, largely through tutorials.</p>
<p><strong>For more information about what life is like at the Faculty, <a href="http://www.theology.ox.ac.uk/blog" target="_blank">visit the Theology and Religion blog.</a></strong></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show odd"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-79071" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>Teaching and Research Showcase</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Podcast: Sacrifice and Modern Thought</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
        <a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/series/sacrifice-and-modern-thought">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/sacrifice-and-modern-thought.jpg?itok=ia-9ZeXW" alt="Sacrifice and Modern Thought" /></a></div>
<p>Sacrifice is at the heart of religion. It is not surprising, then, that the 'turn to religion' we have witnessed over the past two decades has led to a renewed interest in sacrifice as well. In light of this, the Centre for Theology and Modern European Thought at the University of Oxford presents five interviews with contributors to the recently-published book Sacrifice and Modern Thought (ed. Zachhuber and Meszaros, 2013). At around 15 minutes in length, each interview provides an insight into how the modern fascination for the topic of sacrifice has evolved, and how the concept of sacrifice in turn has shaped theological debate, the literary imagination and anthropological theory. We hope you enjoy the recordings.</p>
<p><a href="https://podcasts.ox.ac.uk/units/faculty-theology-and-religion" target="_blank">More podcasts from the Theology and Religion Faculty</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
                        <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-79076" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><h4>Research Project: Compassion in Healthcare: Practical Policy for Civic Life</h4>
<div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image small align-left">
            <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_small/public/humanities/images/media/hvp_2015_logo.jpg?itok=GJqq_wXQ" alt="Healthcare Values Partnership logo" /></div>
<p>The Arts and Humanities Research Council has made a grant of £199,258 to Professor Joshua Hordern, Associate Professor of Christian Ethics, for this 18 month project (January 2017-June 2018). Dr Therese Feiler is the researcher on the project.</p>
<p>The project involves research and knowledge exchange with three healthcare organisations:</p>
<ul><li>Oxford University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust – workshops on compassionate excellence in practice</li>
<li>The Royal College of Physicians London – workshops on medical professionalism <a href="http://www.healthcarevalues.ox.ac.uk/node/199" target="_blank">link</a></li>
<li>The Stratification in Colorectal Cancer Consortium – workshops on ethical issues in personalised, precision medicine <a href="http://www.healthcarevalues.ox.ac.uk/node/196" target="_blank">link</a></li>
</ul><p>The project webpage is <a href="http://www.healthcarevalues.ox.ac.uk/compassion-healthcare-practical-policy-civic-life">here</a>. Further details about the project on the Research Councils UK website may be found <a href="http://gtr.rcuk.ac.uk/projects?ref=AH%2FN009770%2F1" target="_blank">here</a></p>
<p><a href="https://www.theology.ox.ac.uk/research-areas" target="_blank">More research projects and centres from the Faculty of Theology and Religion</a></p>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>
</div>
  </div>

  
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="panel-panel right col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-3"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-3 paragraphs-items-field-region-3-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-3 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-74151" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="file file-image file-image-jpeg embed-image image-thumbnail align-right">
        <a href="https://www.theology.ox.ac.uk">    <img src="http://www.humanities.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mt_image_thumbnail/public/humanities/images/page/theology_logo.jpg?itok=OjE3lfEG" alt="Faculty of Theology and Religion" /></a></div>
<p class="rtecenter">For more information, visit the Theology and Religion Faculty website</p>
<hr /><p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Undergraduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/courses-listing?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Graduate courses</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/graduate/courses/courses-by-department?wssl=1" target="_blank"><em>University website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Research</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.theology.ox.ac.uk/research-areas" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 700;">Academic staff</span></p>
<p><a href="https://www.theology.ox.ac.uk/research-and-teaching-staff" target="_blank"><em>Link to faculty website</em></a></p>
<hr /></div>
            </div>
</div>
  </div>
</div>
</div>
            </div>
</div>

      <div class="row">
      <div class="panel-panel left col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-1"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-1 paragraphs-items-field-region-1-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-1 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-47436" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>INFORMATION ABOUT</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">

      <div class="panel-panel second col-xs-12 col-sm-6 col-md-3 col-lg-3"><div class="panel-pane pane-entity-field pane-node-field-region-2"  >
  
      
  
  <div class="pane-content">
    
<div class="paragraphs-items paragraphs-items-field-region-2 paragraphs-items-field-region-2-full paragraphs-items-full">
  
<div class="field field-name-field-region-2 field-type-paragraphs field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
                  <div class="field-item private-show even"><div class="entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-wysiwyg-content-area margin-bottom widget-width-12-columns paragraphs-item-47441" about="" typeof="">
    <div class="content">
          <h2>INFORMATION FOR</h2>
        
<div class="field field-name-field-content field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">

  <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-sidebar_nav menu-name-menu-og-7716 parent-mlid-18661 menu-level-1">
